sentences: Joshua Michael Tillman (born May 3, 1981), better known by his stage name Father John Misty, is an American musician, singer-songwriter, multi-instrumentalist and record producer.
section: N/A

sentences: He has also performed and released studio albums under the name J. Tillman.
section: N/A

sentences: Maintaining a steady output of solo recordings since 2004, Tillman had been a member of or toured with Demon Hunter, Saxon Shore, Fleet Foxes, Jeffertitti's Nile, Pearly Gate Music, Siberian, Har Mar Superstar, Poor Moon, Low Hums, Jonathan Wilson, and has toured extensively with Pacific Northwest artists Damien Jurado, Jesse Sykes, and David Bazan.
section: N/A

sentences: He has also made contributions to albums by popular artists, including Beyoncé, Lady Gaga, Kid Cudi, and Post Malone and has produced one album for Matthew Daniel Siskin, known as Gambles.
section: N/A
== Early life ==

sentences: Early life ==
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Tillman grew up in an Evangelical Christian household in Rockville, Maryland, a suburb outside of Washington, D.C.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He is the son of Barbara and Irvin C. Tillman, an engineer at Hewlett-Packard, who met at a Christian youth group.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: His mother was raised in Ethiopia, where her parents were missionaries.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: The eldest of four children, he has a brother and two sisters.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Before Tillman settled on a career as a musician, he briefly had ambitions of becoming a pastor because of the performance aspect when he was approximately six years old.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: He comments that his parents focused on the spiritual aspects of his upbringing, which he describes as "culturally oppressive".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: They were estranged for many years, but they reconciled.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After learning drums at a young age, Tillman learned guitar when he was 12.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Tillman was raised in a Baptist church, attended an Episcopal elementary school, then a Pentecostal Messianic day school.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Tillman said he was naive when he was growing up because there was limited cultural influence and no secular music allowed.
section: == Early life ==

sentences: Around the age of 17, there were new stipulations from his parents – he was allowed to listen to secular music that had a "spiritual theme".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: For this reason, his early purchases included albums like Bob Dylan's Slow Train Coming as he was able to establish that Dylan was classified as a "Christian artist".
section: == Early life ==

sentences: After attending Nyack College in New York for a year, Tillman moved to Seattle when he was 21.

sentences: He found a job there working at a bakery, which allowed him to record at night before his 4:30 am shift began.

sentences: A demo he made eventually found its way to Seattle singer and songwriter Damien Jurado.

sentences: A year later Tillman started opening for Jurado.

sentences: At shows Tillman would distribute CD-R copies of songs that would later become his album I Will Return.

sentences: Both albums were later released on Keep Recordings.

sentences: Tillman and Jurado both later signed on for a U.S. tour with Richard Buckner.
section: == Career == | === Early career and Fleet Foxes (2004–2012) ===

sentences: In 2007, Yer Bird Records released his more elaborately arranged fourth album, Cancer and Delirium.
section: == Career == | === Early career and Fleet Foxes (2004–2012) ===

sentences: After signing to independent record label Western Vinyl, Tillman released two albums in 2009, Vacilando Territory Blues and Year in the Kingdom.

sentences: Tillman said he wrote the title track of Vacilando Territory Blues to describe imagery he associates with his move to Seattle.

sentences: His brother Zach subsequently moved there as well and is now in the musical group Pearly Gate Music.

sentences: The following year Tillman released Singing Ax.

sentences: In 2008, Tillman joined Seattle folk rock band Fleet Foxes as their drummer.

sentences: Tillman released a new song entitled "Real Love Baby" on May 19, 2016.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: He appeared on the song "Saturday Night Inside Out" on The Avalanches' second studio album Wildflower, which was released on July 1, 2016.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: Tillman gained media attention on July 22, 2016, after walking off stage at XPoNential Music Festival in Camden, New Jersey, after twenty minutes into his planned fifty-minute performance.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: Instead of performing his setlist, Tillman walked out and asked, "What the fuck is going on?"
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: He then talked for six minutes about the "numbing" role entertainment plays in our lives and how "stupidity just fucking runs the world because entertainment is stupid."
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: When the audience applauded him he asked them not to and responded by saying, "Maybe just take a moment to be really fucking profoundly sad."
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: He finally played a thirteen-minute piece from his then-upcoming album Pure Comedy called "Leaving LA" which references the frustrations he spoke of during his speech.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: Tillman then covered Leonard Cohen's "Bird on the Wire" before telling the crowd he loved them and walked off the stage, cutting his performance short.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The following day, Tillman explained his performance in an Instagram post, in which he called Donald Trump's speech at the 2016 Republican National Convention a "demonic clown pageant coronation of our next potential Idiot King", which took place the night before Tillman's performance.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: In September 2016, his voice and likeness were featured in Brad Neely's animated surreal comedy variety show Harg Nallin' Sclopio Peepio on Adult Swim.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: In the first-season finale episode For Alba, he sings a song titled "This is America" (not affiliated with Childish Gambino's 2018 single "This is America").
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The song features an animated Father John Misty singing what appears to be a humorous parody of his music, with lyrics most likely written by Brad Neely.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The lyrics describe how Americans "die doing the dumbest of crap," such as riding unicycles, ghost hunting, and performing stunts while cosplaying as Batman.

sentences: He also obsessively mentions Go-Gurts throughout the song.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: On January 23, 2017, the single "Pure Comedy" was released alongside an accompanying music video.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The second single released off of Pure Comedy, "Two Wildly Different Perspectives", was released with another music video on January 30, 2017.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The third single released was "Ballad of the Dying Man" on February 1, 2017.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: The fourth single, "Total Entertainment Forever", was released on the night it was performed on Saturday Night Live on March 4, 2017.
section: == Career == | === Subsequent Father John Misty studio albums (2015–2018) ===

sentences: Pure Comedy was released on April 7, 2017.

sentences: The album sees Tillman externalize the stereotypical Father John Misty character that he developed through the two previous albums to prevent himself from being constricted to the character's image, using his personhood and experiences to expose his outlook on life.

sentences: Personal life ==

sentences: Tillman is married to photographer Emma Elizabeth Garr.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They met in Los Angeles at the Laurel Canyon Country Store soon after Tillman moved to the neighborhood in 2011.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They were married in Big Sur in September 2013.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They had lived in New Orleans, Louisiana, but have returned to Los Angeles.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Garr had previously lived in Seattle for several years.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has taken photographs for Father John Misty albums.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tillman was raised in an Evangelical Christian household; he now openly criticizes religion in many of his songs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He has said that he is still culturally Christian "for all intents and purposes," though he is troubled by the way Christianity is commonly expressed in the United States.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tillman has struggled with depression and drug use.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He stated in 2017 that he microdoses on LSD daily to alleviate his depression and anxiety.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He has also stated that he has been diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder "by three therapists."
